org.eclipse.keyple.core.card.message

Class ApduRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.keyple.core.card.message.ApduRequest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public final class ApduRequest
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This POJO wraps a data set related to an ISO-7816 APDU.
    • A byte array containing the raw APDU data.
    • A flag indicating if the APDU is of type 4 (ingoing and outgoing data).
    • A set of integers corresponding to valid status codes in addition to the standard 9000h status word.
    Since:
    0.9
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • ApduRequest

        public ApduRequest(byte[] bytes,
                   boolean case4)
        Constructor.

        bytes contains the APDU command bytes to send to the card.
        The case4 boolean is set to true to indicate that APDU has incoming and outgoing data. It helps to handle cards that present a behaviour not compliant with ISO 7816-3 in contacts mode (not returning the 61XYh status).

        Parameters:
        bytes - A not empty byte array.
        case4 - True if the APDU is in case 4, false if not.
        Since:
        0.9

    • Method Detail

      • setSuccessfulStatusCodes

        public ApduRequest setSuccessfulStatusCodes(java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> successfulStatusCodes)
        The successfulStatusCodes list indicates which status words in the response should be considered successful even though they are different from 9000h.
        Parameters:
        successfulStatusCodes - A not empty Set of Integer.
        Returns:
        the object instance.
        Since:
        1.0

      • isCase4

        public boolean isCase4()
        Indicates if the APDU is type 4.
        Returns:
        True if the APDU is type 4, false if not.
        Since:
        0.9

      • setName

        public ApduRequest setName(java.lang.String name)
        Name this APDU request.

        This name String is dedicated to improving the readability of logs and should therefore only be called conditionally (e.g. level >= debug).

        Parameters:
        name - A not null String.
        Returns:
        the object instance.
        Since:
        0.9
